lines.text: Look, can I give you some advice? You'll never make it down to the harbor. Why don't you all give yourselves up? Either you'll kill somebody, or you'll get killed. Either way - you could start a war!
What is your name?
Whittaker. Walt...

Remark to this, Whittaker Walt. We must have boat. Even now may be too late. This is your island, I make your responsibility you help us get boat quickly, otherwise there is World War III, and everybody is blaming YOU!
Emergency! Everybody to get from street!

In Union of Soviet, when I am only young boy, many are saying, Americanski are bad people, they will attack Russia. So all mistrust American. But I think that I do not mistrust American... not really sinceriously. I wish not to hate... anybody!
[He throws a stone into the sea]
This make good reason to you, Alison Palmer?
Well, of course it does. It doesn't make sense to hate people. It's such a waste of time.
Ask them if they're Russians!
Peter, be quiet.

[thick Russian accent]
Very clever little boy. Very, very clever, to see that my friend and I are foreigners here, but of course not Russian, naturally. What would the Russians be doing on United States of America island, with so many animosities and hatreds between these two countries? It is too funny an idea, is it not? No, we... we are of course... Norveegans.
Norweigans?

[nods]
On a small training exercise for the Nyaato countries...
NATO!
Nay-toe countries, of course, yes. Ah, to reach place of power motorboats it is necessary to make borrowings of automobile, for a short time only, sir.
Uh... uh... may, may I ask you something, please?
Yes, of course.
Are, are there nine of you out there, and are you all Russians with machine guns, and does one of you look like Uncle Ha... I meant, look like a wrestler?

[beat]
Unnnnnnngh... I am sorry to, uh, comply with your statement, but misfortunately, all of the answers to these questions are... yes.
[draws gun]
[last lines]

[as he gallops through the slums]
The Russians are coming! The Russians are coming!

[to his father]
Don't tell them anything! He hasn't even tortured you yet!
Always I am saying goodbye to you, and always I am meeting you again.
[hands his gun to Walt]
You'd better surrender 'cause my Dad has all the guns! So you'd just better surrender...

[to Pete]
Pete. Be quiet!

[to Rozanov]
I'm sorry. Are you hurt?
I'm wounded in dignity only. Please, I know everybody on this island is complete and total crazy. But you, Whittaker Walt? You are crazy too? I only came back here to get Kolchin.

[stammering]
It's just that when I saw you and the gun, well, I thought something had happened to Annie, our daughter. I'm sorry, I... I wasn't trying to... Well, I... I was trying to kill you, I'll admit that, but it wasn't... I mean, it wasn't anything personal.
Hmm... don't do it no more.
No. No. It's the last time I'll ever shoot anybody.
Peace.
[extends his hand]
Peace.
[takes Rozanov's hand and shakes it]
We have... GOT... to get organized!
Tell the Captain he's under arrest.
But I...
Tell the Captain he's under arrest!

[in Russian; subtitled]
The policeman says you are under arrest.

[laughs loudly; in Russian, subtitled]
Tell him that I'm going to blow this town to pieces!

[to Rozanov]
What did he say?

[in English]
Well, he's angry, yes. He says, "you stupid idiot," he will blow up the town.
It is necessary for you to remain in this house at most vigorously for short time only.
Well, we're not going anywhere but...
Good! Please to remain absolutely good behaved so that this man, marksman of prize winning caliber, will not have the necessity of shooting you to small pieces!

[in Russian to Kolchin]
Watch them.
[points to Peter]

[in Russian]
And especially watch that little bastard too.

[in Russian; subtitled]
Comrade, won't you come aboard? Where is everybody?

[in Russian]
Comrade Captain, didn't Lysenko reach you?

[in Russian]
Lysenko? No. Why do you think I'm here, huh?
Tovarishch Kapitan...

[in Russian]
Comrade Lieutenant Rozanov, immediately deliver all the shore party aboard.

[in Russian]
They're not here!

[in Russian]
Rozanov, the Americans are lying to you. Don't belive them. They are holding my sailors prisoners.
Tovarishch Kapitan...

[in Russian]
Comrade Lieutenant Rozanov, I'm giving an order to deliver all my men aboard. Otherwise, I will straighten out this island in such a manner that nobody will be able to find it! I will explode it, do you here me? I will obliterate it from the face of the Earth! I'm giving you three minutes!
[after their submarine runs aground]

[in Russian; subtitled]
Devil take it! What a mess! What a mess.
[Pete accuses his father of collabotaring with the enemy]
You told them everything they wanted to know, just like Arnold Benedict!
That's Benedict Arnold, not Arnold... What are you saying, Pete? Are you saying you think your father is a TRAITOR?
Yes I am! I bet I'm the only kid in the fourth grade whose father IS a famous trader.
That's "traitor". Just stop it, Pete! You're being silly!
[first lines]
[Rozanov arrives on the bridge of the Russian submarine after learing from the chart man how close they are to the USA coast]

[in Russian; subtitled]
What is it Captain? What are you doing?
[to a chart man]
Show me our position.
[the chart man shows Rozanov how close they are to an island]

[in Russian]
What? WHAT? Tovarich Captain...

[in Russian]
Take it easy.

[in Russian]
Permit me, Captain. Look at our position.

[in Russian]
I don't need your advice.

[in Russian]
But this is dangerous! The chart is old! We do not know these waters.

[in Russian]
Comrade Captain, our depth is at 28 fathoms.
Tovarich Captain...

[in Russian]
Rozanov, shut up! You are a fool!

[in Russian]
What? But we're at twenty-eight!

[in Russian]
Leave the tower or I'll place you under arrest!

[in Russian]
23 fathoms.

[in Russian]
Don't you hear it?

[in Russain]
Rozanov, I gave you an order!
[after a pause as the beeping of the sonar grows more intense]

[in Russian]
Sixteen fathoms!

[in Russian to the sailors]
Surface! Stop engines!

[in Russian]
How dare you!

[in Russian]
Twelve fathoms!

[in Russian]
Down periscope! Full speed astern!

[in Russian; looking as the sonar]
Eight... seven... six... five...
[the submarine shutters violently as it runs aground]
I counted them. There are nine of 'em!
Oh, come on, Pete.
Two of them got tommyguns. And they're all talking some foreign language. They could be Russians or something!
Pete, will you sit down and eat your breakfast, please?
Well, I'm sorry to bother you, Chief Mattocks, but I just had a call from Muriel Everett.
What is it, what's she want?
She was shouting that I should call you, because according to her - well, Muriel said the Russians have landed!
Want to give me that again, Alice?
Muriel said the Russians have landed, whatever that means, Chief. And she said they were attacking her personally!
Remember last time, when she called about that Peeping Tom - you know who that was, don't you? It was that Luther Grilk's horse.
Is great idea. I send my men fifty paces and BLOOEY! I congratulate you on extreme genius of this plan. Ptooey!
I thought all the nuts went home on Labor Day.
All right! All right! But only on one condition! Everybody pays cash!

[pointing upward]
Maltchik, maltchik...
Huh? Oh, yeah... we got the kid, didn't we?

[to Alison]
Did your brother Fred come with you? Hi, Fred come in! I've got him now...
[jumps on Kolchin's back]
It's those those high school kids...
[she sees the Russians and then runs into her house]
Russians! Russians!

[in Russian; subtitled]
Gromolsky, go shut her up... but gently!

[to the Russian sub captain after telling him that he's under arrest]
All right, let's have your name and address.

[translating in Russian]
He wants our address.

[to the Russian sailors; in Russian]
Point your gun... take aim right between their eyes!
[the Russians are driving along the road when they see Alison on the road on her bicycle]

[in Russian; subtitled]
Hey, look at that. An American woman. Did you see the build on that...

[in Russian]
Shut up Hurshevsky, and just drive the car!
[after the Russians in the boat eluded capture]
I'm holding you responsible!
[draws sword]
As Commander of the Civilian Forces, in this emergency! I'm charging you with treason!
Gimme that thing!
[grabs his sword and breaks it in half]

[half tearful-half enraged]
That's a Dexter F. Mettles Memorial Sword.
Yeah.

[enraged]
You traitorous fink!
[goes for Mattocks, resulting in a brawl]

[in Russian; subtitled]
Hey, look here. Wheat! American wheat!

[picks up a handfull and sniffs it; in Russian]
That's not wheat you idiot! It's fertilizer.

[in Russian; subtitled]
Fertilizer? You mean manure? Cow...
Da!
